Pros: + Simple to implement. + Works well in practice. + Does not require to build a model, make assumptions, tune parameters. + Can be extended easily with news examples. Question: What are the pros and cons of K-NN? Pros: + Simple to implement. + Works well in practice. + Does not require to build a model, make assumptions, tune parameters. + Can be extended easily with news examples.
Cons: - Requires large space to store the entire training dataset.
front.outsider: - Slow! Given n examples and d features. The method takes O ( n × d ) to run. - Suffers from the curse of dimensionality .

front.region: K-fold Cross Validation A method for estimating test error using training data. Algorithm: Given a learning algorithm A and a dataset D Step 1: Randomly partition D into k equal-size subsets D 1 , . . . , D k Step 2: For j = 1 to k Train A on all D i , i ∈ 1 , . . . k and i = j , and get f j . Apply f j to D j and compute E D j
front.outsider: Step 3: Average error over all folds. k ( E D j ) j =1
